# Data process


## England

### Wave 1 
#### Study-specific variable description


| **Name** | `scqolk` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `I feel that my life has meaning` |
| **Table name** | `wave_1_core_data_v3` |
| **Categories** | `1 =  Often` <br/> `2 = Sometimes` <br/> `3 = Not often` <br/> `4 = Never` |
| **Missings** | `-1 = Item not applicable` <br/> `-9 = Not answered` |
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign w1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ELSA_wb','ELSA.wave_1_core_data_v3', variables=list('scqolk'), missings = TRUE)
ELSA_wb <- opal.execute(o,'ELSA_wb')
```

```{r local w1, echo=F}
vbl <- ELSA_wb$scqolk
vbl_mis <- c(-1,-9)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_mis)[3], caption = names(ELSA_wb)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_mis)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_mis)[2], caption = "Missigns Categories")
ggplot(ELSA_wb, aes(x=factor(scqolk))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `1 into 2`
* `2 into 1`
* `3,4 into 0`
* `-9 into 995`
* `-1 into 996`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}
ELSA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ELSA_wb$id)
ELSA_ds_w1$eudaimonic_wb <- car::recode(ELSA_wb$scqolk, "1=2; 2=1; 3:4=0; -9=995; -1=996; NA=999")
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ELSA_ds_w1$eudaimonic_wb
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ELSA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(eudaimonic_wb))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.




```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}

source("../../helpfunctions.r")

```



```{r summ, echo=F}

# All study waves and populations with abbreviated and descriptive names


elsa.cw <- list(w1 = c("w1","W1"), w2 = c("w2","W2"), w3 = c("w3","W3"), w4 = c("w4","W4"), w5 = c("w5","W5"), w6 = c("w6","W6"), w7 = c("w7","W7"))

# Consider only harmonised waves
l.hds <- lapply(elsa.cw, function(wname) if(exists(paste0("ELSA_ds_",wname[1]))){wname = list(get(paste0("ELSA_ds_",wname[1])),wname[2])})
nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}

m.hds <- list()

lmlist <- list(lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]]),m.hds)

if(length(l.hds)>0){
  # Labelling tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]])
  # Printing table of categories
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]])),caption=ds_label))
  # Printing table of trajectories
  f.dbb <- trajectories(lmlist[[2]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
  print(knitr::kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,]))
  # Saving tibbles
  savingRD(lmlist[[1]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
}



```
